headline: Nvidia earnings, Fed Chair Powell, April PCE: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime anchors Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton preview the biggest news stories and market headlines expected out next week, including earnings results from semiconductor giant Nvidia (NVDA), HP Inc. (HPQ), Salesforce (CRM), and retailers Kohl's (KSS), Costco (COST), and Dick's Sporting Goods (DKS); commentary from Federal Reserve Jerome Powell on Sunday; and April's Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) index coming out next Friday. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

headline: Salesforce in Talks Again to Buy Informatica
summary: Salesforce, Inc. (NYSE:CRM) is once again in discussions to acquire Informatica Inc. (NYSE:INFA), a cloud data management company, after a previous round of talks earlier in 2024 ended without a deal, according to sources familiar with the matter. People close to the situation say an agreement could be announced as early as next week, though […]

headline: Salesforce Back in Deal Talks With Informatica
summary: Salesforce  is again in talks to acquire data-management software firm  Informatica  according to people familiar with the matter, after a deal between the two fizzled last year.  Last year, Salesforce was discussing a deal to buy Informatica that could have valued the Redwood City, Calif.-based company in the neighborhood of $10 billion.  After the companies couldn’t agree on terms, the talks fell apart, The Wall Street Journal reported last April.

headline: Salesforce Stock Drops, Informatica Soars. A Deal May Be Back on the Table.
summary: Salesforce  stock was down Friday after a report said that talks for a potential acquisition of  Informatica  were back on after falling apart in 2024.  Bloomberg reported Friday afternoon that enterprise software company  Salesforce  was in talks to acquire data management platform Informatica, citing people familiar with the matter.  An official announcement of a deal could come next week if an agreement is reached.

An official announcement of a deal could come next week if an agreement is reached.

headline: Informatica stock soars on acquisition talks; Salesforce dips
summary: Investing.com -- Shares of Informatica (NYSE: INFA) surged over 20% today after reports emerged that Salesforce (NYSE: NYSE:CRM) is in renewed talks to acquire the cloud data management firm. The news, first reported by Bloomberg, has reignited interest in a deal that was previously considered but did not materialize last year. Meanwhile, Salesforce stock fell 3% amidst the speculation.
